frame.name: Documents
frame.definition: <def-root>Words in the frame refer to any <fen>Document</fen> that has a legal status. Some <fen>Document</fen> empowers the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen> to execute the <fen>Right</fen>. Others indicate the <fen>Obligation</fen> of the <fen>Bearer</fen>. Still others show the identity or <fen>Status</fen> of the <fen>Bearer</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Bearer
FE.definition: <def-root>The holder of the document. <ex><fex name="Bearer">My </fex><t>visa</t> will expire next month.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Issuer
FE.definition: <def-root>The authority that issues the document. <ex><fex name="Issuer">US consulate</fex> issued a <t>Visa</t> to Ms. Yang to travel to San Francisco.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Obligation
FE.definition: <def-root>Obligation is the obligation that is imposed on the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen>. <ex>They were all under <t>subpoena</t> <fex name="Obligation">to appear in court.</fex></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Right
FE.definition: <def-root>Right is the right of the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen> that is authorized by the <fen>Document</fen>. <ex><fex name="Bearer">Raymond</fex> has a <fex name="Right">fishing</fex> <t>licence</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Status
FE.definition: <def-root>Status is the state of the Bearer of the Document indicated by the Document. <ex>The couple just got <fex name="Bearer">their</fex> <fex name="Status">marriage</fex> <t>certificate</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Specification
FE.definition: <def-root>Specification is the condiontion that has to do with the <fen>Right</fen> and <fen>Obligation</fen> of the Document. <ex>Before you get your driver's liscense, you need to carry your <fex name="Specification">temporary</fex> driving <t>permit</t> when you drive. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Document
FE.definition: <def-root>Document is the piece of paper that has the legal status. <ex>The police need a <fex name="Right">search</fex> <fex name="Document">warrant</fex> to enter his house.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>The language the <fen>Document</fen> is written in, or a specification of the kind of object that instantiates it.
<ex>We only need an <fex name="Medium">electronic</fex> <t>confirmation</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Descriptor</fen> covers any characterization or description of the target that is not covered by another more specific FE.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: visa.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an endorsement on a passport indicating that the holder is allowed to enter, leave, or stay for a specified period of time in a country.

lexUnit.name: passport.n
lexUnit.definition: cOD: an official document issued by a government, certifying the holder's identity and citizenship and entitling them to travel abroad under its protection.

lexUnit.name: subpoena.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a writ ordering a person to attend a court.

lexUnit.name: warrant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an official authorization enabling the police or some other body to make an arrest, search premises, etc.

lexUnit.name: certificate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an official document attesting or recording a particular fact or event, a level of achievement, the fulfilment of a legal requirement, etc.

lexUnit.name: papers.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: sheets of paper covered with writing or printing; documents.

lexUnit.name: licence.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a permit from an authority to own or use something, do a particular thing, or carry on a trade (especially in alcoholic liquor).

lexUnit.name: summons.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an order to appear in a law court.

lexUnit.name: diploma.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a certificate awarded by an educational establishment for passing an examination or completing a course of study.

lexUnit.name: deed.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a legal document, especially one relating to property ownership or legal rights.

lexUnit.name: lease.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a contract by which one party conveys land, property, services, etc. to another for a specified time.

lexUnit.name: agreement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a contract by which one party conveys land, property, services, etc. to another for a specified time.

lexUnit.name: treaty.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formally concluded and ratified agreement between states.

lexUnit.name: charter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a written grant by a sovereign or legislature, by which a body such as a university is created or its rights and privileges defined.

lexUnit.name: authorization.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a legal document that gives official permission for or approval to something

lexUnit.name: deposition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a statement to be used as evidence.

lexUnit.name: brief.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a summary of the facts and legal points in a case given to a barrister to argue in court

lexUnit.name: writ.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a form of written command in the name of a court or other legal authority to do or abstain from doing a specified act

lexUnit.name: affidavit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a written statement confirmed by oath or affirmation, for use as evidence in court.

lexUnit.name: will.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a legal document containing instructions for the disposition of one's money and property after one's death

lexUnit.name: testimony.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal statement, especially one given in a court of law

lexUnit.name: testament.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person's will.

lexUnit.name: ruling.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a decision made by court

lexUnit.name: finding.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a conclusion reached as a result of a trial

lexUnit.name: opinion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal statement of reasons for a judgement given

lexUnit.name: title.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a right or claim to the ownership of property or to a rank or throne

lexUnit.name: orders.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a legal written document that specifies the rules to be followed

lexUnit.name: contract.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a written or spoken agreement intended to be enforceable by law

lexUnit.name: permit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an official document giving permission to do something.

lexUnit.name: document.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: A written or printed paper that bears the original, official, or legal form of something and can be used to furnish decisive evidence or information.

lexUnit.name: contractual.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: of or relating to a legally binding document, i.e., a contract.

lexUnit.name: accord.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an official agreement or treaty.

lexUnit.name: confirmation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: something that serves to confirm
